sentences:
Sentence 0:
The continuous cofermentation performance of xylose-fermenting Zymomonas mobilis at 30 degrees C and pH 5.5 was characterized using a pure-sugar feed solution that contained 8 g/L glucose and 40 g/L xylose.

Sentence 1:
Whereas xylose and cell-mass concentrations increased gradually with increasing dilution rate, ethanol concentrations and ethanol yields on available sugars remained approximately constant at 20-22 g/L and 80-90% of theoretical, respectively.

Sentence 2:
Volumetric and specific ethanol productivities increased linearly with increasing dilution rate, rising from approx 1.0 g/L/h or g/g/h) at a dilution rate of 0.04/h to approx 2.0 g/L/h or g/g/h) at a dilution rate of 0.10/h.

Sentence 3:
Similarly, specific sugar-utilization rates increased from approx 2.0 g/g/h at dilution rate 0.04/h to approx 3.5 g/g/h at dilution rate of 0.10/h.
sentence_raw: The continuous cofermentation performance of xylose-fermenting Zymomonas mobilis at 30 degrees C and pH 5.5 was characterized using a pure-sugar feed solution that contained 8 g/L glucose and 40 g/L xylose.

Whereas xylose and cell-mass concentrations increased gradually with increasing dilution rate, ethanol concentrations and ethanol yields on available sugars remained approximately constant at 20-22 g/L and 80-90% of theoretical, respectively.

Volumetric and specific ethanol productivities increased linearly with increasing dilution rate, rising from approx 1.0 g/L/h or g/g/h) at a dilution rate of 0.04/h to approx 2.0 g/L/h or g/g/h) at a dilution rate of 0.10/h.
Similarly, specific sugar-utilization rates increased from approx 2.0 g/g/h at dilution rate 0.04/h to approx 3.5 g/g/h at dilution rate of 0.10/h.
